Welcome and Thank You for Choosing AAMI

This Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) is an important document that tells you information you need to know about your policy. It is really important to read it carefully before you decide whether or not our cover is right for you.

By Choosing AAMI You Can:

  • Manage your policy using our AAMI App or online
  • Make a claim 24/7 by calling 13 22 44, using our AAMI App or online
  • Call on 13 22 44 or chat with us online with the AAMI Virtual Assistant for extra support

The information in this PDS is current on the date it was prepared. From time to time, we may update some of the information in the PDS that is not materially adverse to you without notifying you. Please contact us for a free copy of any updates. Other changes will be made by a Supplementary Product Disclosure Statement (SPDS) which we will give to you.

Key Information about AAMI Home Building Insurance

This policy provides cover for loss or damage to your home (the building). We do not cover the building for all types of loss or damage. We do not cover your contents.

If you also want cover for your contents, you might like to consider AAMI Home Contents Insurance.

What We Pay

If you have a sum insured shown on your certificate

What We Cover

We cover specific events like storm, fire (including bushfire), escape of liquid and impact.

Legal Liability

We cover your legal liability to pay compensation for death or bodily injury to other people, or loss or damage to their property.

This is a summary only. Like all policies, there are conditions, limits and exclusions that apply so you need to read your policy for full details.

Additional Cover That Comes With Your Policy

There are some additional covers that come with your policy for no extra cost. See section 5 'Additional cover that comes with your policy' on page 53 for more information.

Optional Cover You Can Pay Extra For

There are some optional covers that you have to pay extra for. If an optional cover applies to your policy, it is shown on your certificate of insurance. See section 6 'Optional cover you can pay extra for' on page 65 for more information.

Exclusion for New Policies

We do not insure you for bushfire, storm, storm surge, flood or tsunami in the first 72 hours of your policy. Very limited exceptions apply. See section 3 'Things we don't cover' on page 26 for more information.

Summary of Cover

Limits, conditions and exclusions apply. Read your policy for full details.

What We Cover

What We Cover

  • Other repair or rebuilding costs
  • Removal of debris
  • Temporary accommodation
  • Motor burnout
  • Accidental breakage of glass
  • Exploratory costs due to escape of liquid
  • Damage from physical injury or incident

These are the standard covers included with your policy.

Optional Covers

  • Complete Replacement Cover
  • Accidental damage to home
  • Excess-free glass cover
  • AAMI Home Assist

These are optional covers available for an additional fee.

What to Do

  1. Make sure everyone is safe and call 000 in case of an emergency.
  2. Prevent further loss or damage by covering holes in the roof, etc.
  3. Report theft or malicious damage to the police as soon as possible.
  4. Contact us as soon as possible to report your claim.

Please note that delaying your claim may result in reduced compensation.

Our Agreement with You

If you buy this product from us, your contract of insurance is made up of your certificate of insurance, this Product Disclosure Statement (PDS), and any Supplementary Product Disclosure Statements (SPDS) that we give you.

We may send you policy documents and communications electronically. We will obtain your express or inferred consent to do so, and it will be deemed received by you when it leaves our information system.

Cooling Off Period

You can contact us to return the policy within 21 days from the start date of your policy, including on renewal. This is called the cooling-off period. During this time, we will refund the full amount you paid, including GST, if applicable. However, you will not have any cover under the policy. You can cancel your policy at any time, and if you do, you will still have cover until the date and time of cancellation, unless we tell you otherwise. For more information, see 'What Happens with Cancellations' on page 98.

Limits of Our Cover

Like every insurance policy, there are exclusions, conditions, and limits that apply to your policy. These are outlined in section 3, 'Things We Don't Cover,' on pages 23 to 36. Additionally, there are specific things we don't cover, which are explained in sections 4 to 6, on pages 37 to 70, depending on the type of cover you have.

We use symbols and icons to help explain what's covered and what's not covered in this PDS.

Extra Support

If your circumstances change, and you need additional support, such as due to physical or mental health issues, family or financial difficulties, or cultural background, you can tell us, and we'll work with you to arrange support.

Your Responsibilities

**HTML Output** ```html AAMI Insurance Information

About Your Sum Insured

There are changes to any business activity you operate at the insured address, such as but not limited to, the type of business activity changes, people start to come to the insured address, business signage is installed and storage of chemicals for the business activity occurs.

You need to change the sum insured for your building.

Any detail on your certificate of insurance is no longer accurate, such as but not limited to the description of the building.

You intend to demolish the building, have lodged an application to do so, or a government authority has issued a demolition order.

You start to use or let all or part of the building to tenants, including under any short-term rental, holiday letting, or house sharing arrangement. This includes any arrangements booked through an online booking platform.

Trespassers or squatters occupy the insured address.

Building, renovations, construction, alterations, and/or repairs commence at the insured address.

If you have not told us about any of the above matters having occurred in any other period of insurance you held with us, you must also tell us as soon as possible.

What We Will Do When You Contact Us

When you tell us about any of the above matters, an additional excess, additional premium, or special condition may be applied to your policy. In some cases, it may lead to a reduction or refusal to pay a claim, or cancellation of your policy.

If you do not contact us, you may not be covered under your policy, and it may lead to a reduction or refusal to pay a claim, or cancellation of your policy.

How to Contact Us

Call us on 13 22 44.

If Your Contact Details Change

You must keep your contact details, including your Australian Mobile number, postal address, and email address, up to date. If we do not have up-to-date contact details, you may not receive your important policy documents, which could

Here is the resulting HTML code: ```html Home Building Insurance

Excesses

Excess is the amount you pay towards the cost of your claim.

Types of Excess

  • AAMI Flexi-Premiums excess
  • Additional excess
  • Unoccupied excess

AAMI Flexi-Premiums excess

This excess applies to all claims unless your policy states otherwise.

Additional excess

This excess may apply to your policy based on our assessment of the risk.

Unoccupied excess

This excess applies if the building is unoccupied for more than 60 days.

Examples of how to prove occupancy include:

  • Copies of bills
  • Photos of furnishings

Refer to the Home Building Insurance Additional Information Guide for more information.

Claiming for Both Building and Contents

If both the building and contents are insured at the same address, you must pay the higher of the two excesses.

Paying Your Excess

  • You can pay the excess directly to us before we finalize your claim.
